intro: Cystium boiseanum, commonly known as the Boise thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster. The leaves are narrow and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
